name: Bullet Heck (Multiplayer VS)
description:
This is an early prototype version of the game "Crossfire: Barrage" That is in development as a hobby. This version was compiled 23-1-2021 and is the most up to date version of the prototype, which was called Bullet Heck  at the time.

--Default Controls [Parsec VS]

[Enter] - Select on Main Menu

[Escape] - Pause Game

Player 1 - Green

Arrow Keys - Move

ASDF - Use Card

LShift - Hold To Trash Card (Known issue causing numlock to freeze up and input other button commands)

Player 2 - Magenta

Number Pad - Move

JKL; - Use Card

RAlt - Hold to Trash Card

--How to Play

Each player has 4 card slots, each randomly chosen from any possible card in the game.

Any card can be trashed by having a small amount of mana to "Trash" the card. do so by holding your Trash button

Each has their own unique design to them, mana useage, and damage delt per bullet

The Players cannont enter eachothers "Sanctuaries" but your own "Sanctuary" allows you to replenish your hp and mana 2x faster

Your health at 1/2, 1/4, and 1/10 replenish twice as fast for each factor, lower hp means you will die more often, but you are able to summon more cards

--Shortcuts and Debug Tools

press [LAlt] on title screen to skip right to battle

press [Enter] in battle to restart the battle

press [f3] to activate debug mode

while in debug mode press [f2] and [f4] to choose a specific card to test

--Intentions going forward

The prototype is finished, we've done everything we wanted to do with it, and we're working on a more complete game called "Crossfire: Barrage" which sets the idea of this prototype forward by having faster paced gameplay, a class based gamemode, higher readability, online multiplayer, and gamepad oriented design. We have nothing to announce at the time of this prototype's release.

We hope you can enjoy this demo in the meantime, Follow our endevours moving forward @BulletHeck on twitter

https://twitter.com/BulletHeck

Original Idea

Both Squaggies and Mezzo Roo came up with the idea of this game independently, and we decided to make the game together. I, Squaggies, and writing this readme so I can say where I initally got the idea of the game from, we coined the idea in late 2019 to eachother. Where I said "What if you could play UNDERTALE, but as the enemies, like you fight eachother" and if I remember correctly, Mezzo had the idea for a TouHou Game in the same sorta idea years prior and mentioned the idea when I brought up the game's idea, and then we started working together. The game's backend is a lot more clunky compared to "Crossfire: Barrage" I really hope one day that we can release the new version of the game as it's a lot better, but alas, subscription services are annoying and expensive when you're a hobbiest that only works on the game a few times a month at most.

Thank you for reading and supporting the game! Hope we can show something soon!

-Crossfire: Barrage Team
